mobs.long_desc: A contented-looking half-elf tends to the counter.
mobs.desc: A little short for a half-elf, this mage is graced with pale blond hair and the muscular frame of his human side.  His eyes are a pale, icy blue color, but there is warmth in them.  His clothing is an odd mixture of silvery silks and light blue cottons, all of the highest quality.  The overall impression is of someone sleek and capable.

mobs.keywords: tai'ir man muscular taiir soaking chosen-endings
mobs.long_desc: A muscular man soaks in the hot spring.
mobs.desc: Scars crisscross the muscular body of this man.  He moves with feline grace, though for the most part he seems content to sit here and let the hot waters soak his troubles away.  Obviously looking for privacy, he has chosen this pool to avoid the women in the resort.  On his forehead is a strange, purple tattoo.

mobs.keywords: monk jaden blind-monk journeys-chosen gliding graceful
mobs.long_desc: A blind monk glides gracefully along his way.
mobs.desc: Dressed in robes of soft blue, this monk has a black silk blindfold covering his eyes.  Despite this impediment to vision, he smiles cheerfully and seems to be able to move around without worrying about bumping into anything.  On his forehead is an unfamiliar symbol, glowing a bright blue.

mobs.long_desc: A vigorous monk is here, enjoying the hot springs.
mobs.desc: Constantly in motion, this monk seems to have too much energy despite the relaxing care of the hot springs.  Still, his moves are graceful, like a large cat hot on the scent of prey.  Long scars on his back are almost reminiscent of lash marks, but his beefy form attests to someone who can take care of himself. An unfamiliar symbol on his forehead glows bright red.

mobs.long_desc: A quiet monk is reading by the fire.
mobs.desc: She is a little on the short side, and ignores people quite effectively when occupied with her book.  When she does move, it is with an elegance that speaks of martial training - not what one would expect from a scholar.  A half-smirk on her face implies that she knows everything.  A strange symbol on her forehead glows with a soft yellow light.

mobs.long_desc: A sensuous woman relaxes in the hot springs.
mobs.desc: Her hair is dark brown, almost black, and it is pinned up to keep dry.  Her skin is dusky, as though she sees a lot of sunlight.  Her eyes are a piercing blue, and they don't seem to miss much.  She is built like a warrior but moves more like a gymnast.  An almost palpable air of serenity surrounds her.

mobs.long_desc: A pyromancer is relaxing in the hottest part of the pool.
mobs.desc: This man doesn't seem entirely human.  Maybe it's the color of his hair - yellow at the roots, slowly darkening to orange and then a rich red, with black at the very tips.  Maybe it's his skin (golden) or his eyes (also golden), but he seems more like a creature from the plane of Fire who's only wearing a human form for this vacation.  That in mind, why is he visiting a water resort?

mobs.long_desc: An arctic druid wanders the halls of the resort.
mobs.desc: White feathers woven into her dark hair make this woman look quite exotic. Her clothing has patterns reminiscent of animal camoflauge, but is made from thick linens and cottons rather than real animal skins.  She seems very serene and always has a smile on her face.

mobs.keywords: woman rianne d'argent silver-haired regal cook chef
mobs.long_desc: A regal, silver-haired woman is here, waving around a spoon.
mobs.desc: She is tall, but not overly so.  Her quick grey eyes don't miss anything that goes on in her domain, for she is the Queen of the Kitchen.  Not a knife goes dull nor a dish unperfected.  It is said that elves live for hundreds of years, so her mastery of gourmet has the potential to far surpass any mortal cook.

mobs.long_desc: A white fish swims gracefully through the water.
mobs.desc: A favorite catch of fishermen everywhere, the trout is a fish that loves streams and brooks.  This particular variety has adapted itself to the waters that flow from the hot spring, so is leaner than other varieties of fish found in this region.  Its coloring is a mottled brown-white to blend in with the rocks and ice, and is well-known for its flaky flesh that tastes delicious in fish stew.

mobs.long_desc: An inconspicuous youth inspects the resort here.
mobs.desc: Sandy brown hair and pale eyes make this young man barely noticeable up north, where most people have that coloring.  He is small, but quick, and his build is of an athlete rather than a warrior.  He doesn't have any visible weapons and is clad in a very generic brown fur wrap.

mobs.keywords: guest peaceful-looking resort customer resort-guest resort-customer
mobs.long_desc: A peaceful-looking resort customer wanders around here.
mobs.desc: He has the bearing of a military officer, but he's obviously on vacation. He's dressed in the sort of loose robe provided by the resort to its patrons for casual wear.  Dark hair and tanned skin speak of an origin far to the south - the resort seems to be popular with all kinds of people!

mobs.long_desc: A scarred man is relaxing in the pool here.
mobs.desc: A few scars mark this man as a fighter, though he seems to be compeltely relaxed in the pool.  He has the look of someone from Ickle, probably a local out enjoying some extra vacation time.  He probably wouldn't like to be disturbed - but then, who would?

mobs.long_desc: An osprey watches the waters for signs of fish.
mobs.desc: Also known as the fighing eagle, the osprey is a magnificent bird.  Its feathers are white speckled with brown, its talons are long and sharp, and its beak is deadly to its prey.  It has dark, beady eyes that can see for a very long distance and can make out the shape of a fish even through the ice.

mobs.long_desc: A muscular druid stands ready at a massage chair.
mobs.desc: This large druid is clad in simple robes with a golden aspen-leaf necklace identifying his class.  His face is lit with a gentle smile.  A nametag pinned to his robes says he is Eamon, the resident massage therapist of Phoenix Feather.  Under his robes, his arms are tattooed, but the figures are difficult to make out.

mobs.long_desc: A skillful barista is here, ready to sell drinks to patrons.
mobs.desc: By his official-looking posture, he appears to be an employee of the resort. Dark brown hair is neatly tied back and his hands are stained dark from mixing up drinks.  A true master of his craft, this man is capable of mixing and brewing up any hot drink that is ordered.

objects.ground: A pale blue crystal on a silver chain rests here.

extras.text: It shimmers of its own light, constantly reflecting the emotional state of its owner.  The setting is a delicate filgiree net that encases the crystal and keeps it safe while still allowing it to be visible.  A strange energy shocks anyone who tries to touch it directly unless the crystal is their own.

objects.ground: A white towel is folded here.

extras.text: This is a simple, fuzzy white towel.  It looks quite water-absorbant and is the kind of thing you'd want to wear around your head to keep your hair from getting soaked, or to dry off your hair in case it's already wet.  There's a small tag on one end that reads, "Property of Phoenix Feather Hot Springs".

objects.ground: A green towel has been tossed on the ground here.

extras.text: This is a large, fluffy towel dyed dark green.  Though it is well-made, it looks like it's seen plenty of use and has a slight sulfur smell from the mineral water.  Still, it would be good either to dry oneself off or to wear around the waist to preserve decency while bathing.  A small tag on one of the hems says "Phoenix Feather Hot Springs".

objects.ground: A neatly folded light blue towel has been left here.

extras.text: This cute towel is the pure blue of a winter sky.  Made of fine cotton, it would be ideal for covering oneself in the hot springs or for drying off afterwards.  Though well-used, it seems to be in good condition.  A white tag on the hem says, "Property of Phoenix Feather Hot Springs".

objects.ground: A frightening mask is sitting here.

extras.text: Made of beaten gold and shaped into the fearsome visage of a scowling demon, this mask is complete with curling white horns.  Sure to frighten anyone gazing upon it, the demon's face is both ugly and true to form.  Perhaps it was modeled after a real demon.

objects.ground: A golden lantern shines with a pale light here.

extras.text: This lanters glows with a strange, almost dark light.  A brass shielding lets the user focus the light on one side or, by lowering it, allows the light to spread around and illuminate everything.  Though ancient, the goldwork is plain and the only decoration is a dragon etched on the handle.

objects.ground: A tasty green apple rolls around on the floor.

extras.text: It's a scrumptious-looking apple, dripping with yummy apple juice and crunching noisily when bitten into.  It looks quite fresh, and would surely taste excellent.  It's nice and round and has nary a wormhole, so what are you waiting for??  Eat it!

objects.ground: A pair of silver-trimmed glasses has been abandoned here.

extras.text: These finely ground lenses must be gnomish work, for they seem to be flawless. The rims are a thin silver and the nosepiece seems quite comfortable.  They would surely be a great help to someone who has no near-vision that wants to read a book or crochet or do anything else that requires them to see things close up.

objects.ground: A pile of snowy white cloth has been carelessly dropped here.

extras.text: This finely woven cloak is made of pure white satin with cotton embroidery marking out an abstract bird symbol on the back which, though it is also in white, shows up in string light due to the difference in luster between the two fabrics.  Long ties at the neck can be used to fasten the cloak against the chill winds of the north.  It looks like it would also make great camoflauge in the snow.

objects.ground: A pitcher of cool drinking water sits on a shelf.

extras.text: A sizeable pitcher made of some dwarven alloy that won't rust or tarnish even in the steam from the hot springs sits on a stone shelf.  Condensation has formed on the outside of the pitcher, and it has a little cap to prevent the water inside from evaporating.  It must be magically cooled as well, but then, the resort IS owned and managed by a cryomancer.

objects.ground: A slender wooden spoon has been lost here.

extras.text: An ordinary kitchen utensil...  Or is it?

objects.ground: A tasty bit of white fish meat is sitting here.

extras.text: It's a bit of meat from the elusive polar trout.  Fry it up with dill or mince it into pies for the best flavor.  It's said that te natives of Odaishyozen eat raw fish with rice, but it would probably taste better cooked.

objects.ground: A pile of brown fur sits on the ground.

extras.text: A style popular in Ickle, this length of warm fur looks like it's made fromgrizzly bear hide, which is excellent at keeping in the warmth.  On the inside is a small sigil burned into the leather: a stylized four-pointed sun, symbol of the tribe of the Bear in the Canyons.

objects.ground: A neatly folded cotton robe rests here.

extras.text: This light blue robe is decorated with a feather pattern, identifying it as belonging to the Phoenix Feather Resort west of Ickle.  The style is familiar to anyone who knows the customs of Odaishyozen: it's meant to be worn in the same way as a kimono.  Because it's made of cotton rather than silk and designed for more casual wear, this style of robe is called a yukata.  It was probably designed by someone from the resort who visited the Emerald Isle.

objects.ground: A green gem of remarkable beauty rests on the floor.

extras.text: It's a large emerald, about the size of a bean.  It glows with a brilliant green light, illuminating the area around it.  It is undoubtedly enchanted, since it's warm to the touch and gives off a faint sense of well-being to anyone who picks it up.  Looking closely, the very faint outline of a hawk is visible on one facet.

objects.ground: A mug with the insignia of Phoenix Feather Hot Springs is sitting here.

extras.text: The symbol is that of a single red feather slanting diagonally against a snowflake.
It's a large cermaic mug with enough room for a few drinks of liquid.  It's marked with the insignia of Phoenix Feather Hot Springs.

objects.ground: A mug with the insignia of Phoenix Feather Hot Springs is sitting here.

extras.text: It's a large cermaic mug with enough room for a few drinks of liquid.  It's marked with the insignia of Phoenix Feather Hot Springs.
The symbol is that of a single red feather slanting diagonally against a snowflake.

objects.ground: A mug with the insignia of Pheonix Feather Hot Springs is sitting here.

extras.text: It's a large cermaic mug with enough room for a few drinks of liquid.  It's marked with the insignia of Phoenix Feather Hot Springs.
The symbol is that of a single red feather slanting diagonally against a snowflake.

objects.ground: A mug with the insignia of Phoenix Feather Hot Springs is sitting here.

extras.text: The symbol is that of a single red feather slanting diagonally against a snowflake.
It's a large cermaic mug with enough room for a few drinks of liquid.  It's marked with the insignia of Phoenix Feather Hot Springs.

objects.ground: A mug with the insignia of Phoenix Feather Hot Springs is sitting here.

extras.text: It's a large cermaic mug with enough room for a few drinks of liquid.  It's marked with the insignia of Phoenix Feather Hot Springs.
The symbol is that of a single red feather slanting diagonally against a snowflake.

objects.ground: A small cup about the size of a shot glass sits here.

extras.text: This cute little cup is made of white porcelain, delicately painted with snowflakes.  The white and blue coloring is strongly reminiscent of Odaishyozen.  Perhaps it was imported, though the potential cost of bringing pottery across most of Caelia is staggering.

objects.ground: A tall glass with a handle sits here proudly.

extras.text: Much taller than a regular drinking glass, it has a base and stem and handle like a mug.  Perhaps it's made to hold hot liquids?

objects.ground: A teacup painted with a phoenix sits here.

extras.text: This beautiful porcelain teacup is painted with a phoenix in the style of Odaishyozen.  Its handle is small enough that it doesn't detract from the artistry, but large enough that a hot drink could be consumed without any danger of burning one's fingers.

objects.ground: A teacup painted with a phoenix sits here.

extras.text: This beautiful porcelain teacup is painted with a phoenix in the style of Odaishyozen.  Its handle is small enough that it doesn't detract from the artistry, but large enough that a hot drink could be consumed without any danger of burning one's fingers.

objects.ground: A gold-trimmed leather-bound tome of spells rests on a nearby shelf.

extras.text: This softly glowing book contains some of the most miraculous and dangerous magic known to Cryomancers.  Embossed with gold and written with golden ink, the magic radiating from the tome is palpable.  Flipping through it, the book has many long-lost spells like To Bring Winter on Water, Fisher of the Polar Deep, Blood Bender, Phantom's Gondola, the Burning Rain of Death, Watergate, and more.

shops.no_such_item2: %s If you had one, I might consider it.
shops.do_not_buy: %s I don't trade in such items.
shops.missing_cash1: %s I don't have enough money to buy it.
shops.missing_cash2: %s Come back when you have more money.
shops.message_sell: %s I'm sure someone will want this.

triggers.name: thief_steal_stuff
triggers.commands: *Thief steal stuff trigger... *Chose a set of common keywords and aligned percentage chances *so that it has a random chance to steal any of the keywords set rnd %random.100% if %rnd% > 99 set loot gem elseif %rnd% == 99 set loot iron elseif %rnd% <= 98 && %rnd% >= 97 set loot cloth elseif %rnd% <= 96 && %rnd% >= 95 set loot wood elseif %rnd% <= 94 && %rnd% >= 93 set loot white elseif %rnd% <= 92 && %rnd% >= 90 set loot red elseif %rnd% <= 89 && %rnd% >= 85 set loot blue elseif %rnd% <= 84 && %rnd% >= 80 set loot green elseif %rnd% <= 79 && %rnd% >= 76 set loot black elseif %rnd% <= 75 && %rnd% >= 71 set loot dagger elseif %rnd% <= 70 && %rnd% >= 66 set loot shield elseif %rnd% <= 65 && %rnd% >= 61 set loot sword elseif %rnd% <= 60 && %rnd% >= 56 set loot leather elseif %rnd% <= 55 && %rnd% >= 46 set loot raft elseif %rnd% <= 45 && %rnd% >= 36 set loot canoe elseif %rnd% <= 35 && %rnd% >= 26 set loot sack elseif %rnd% <= 25 && %rnd% >= 16 set loot bag elseif %rnd% <= 15 set loot gem endif *now the real command! steal %loot% %actor.name%

triggers.name: fish-death
triggers.commands: mload obj 10311

triggers.name: rianne-greet
triggers.commands: wait 1s if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.quest_stage[resort_cooking]% >= 1 switch %actor.quest_stage[resort_cooking]% case 1 set recipe Peach Cobbler break case 2 set recipe Seafood Salad break case 3 set recipe Fish Stew break case 4 set recipe Honey-Glazed Ham break case 5 set recipe Saffroned Jasmine Rice break default halt done mecho %self.name% says, 'Welcome back, %actor.name%! mecho &0Have you brought me the ingredients for &7&b%recipe%?&0' wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'Remember, you can look in the icebox to see what you've mecho &0already brought me.' wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'Oh, and the recipe for &7&b%recipe%&0 is on the wall!' else mecho %self.name% says, 'Welcome to Phoenix Feather Resort, %actor.name%! mecho &0My name is %self.name% and I am the cook here.' wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'But I could use a little help!  Being located up north mecho &0makes it hard to get everything I need for some of my more exotic dishes.' wait 2s say %actor.name% do you think you could help me? smile %actor.name% endif endif

triggers.name: rianne-quest-start
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 && %actor.quest_stage[resort_cooking]% < 1 quest start resort_cooking %actor.name% wait 5 mecho %self.name% says, 'Excellent!  The dish I am making next is &7&bPeach Cobbler&0.' wait 2s say I will need you to find the following ingredients for me: mecho - &7&b%get.obj_shortdesc[61501]%&0 mecho - &7&b%get.obj_shortdesc[23754]%&0 mecho - &7&b%get.obj_shortdesc[3114]%&0 mecho - &7&b%get.obj_shortdesc[35001]%&0 wait 2s say Bring them to me quickly so that I may begin! wink %actor.name% wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'Oh!  And you can look at my recipe wall at any time to mecho &0see what else we need.' endif

triggers.name: rianne-quest-receive
triggers.commands: * * Added by Daedela 3-9-2021 for Group Heal quest * if %actor.quest_stage[group_heal]% == 5 if %actor.quest_variable[group_heal:%self.vnum%]% if %object.vnum% == 18514 say I've told you everything I can.  Good luck! halt endif else if %object.vnum% == 18514 quest variable group_heal %actor.name% %self.vnum% 1 return 0 say Well you've definitely come to the right place! wait 4 emote reads over the ritual recipe. wait 4s mecho %self.name% says, 'Oh my, what a challenge.  No wonder someone would need help with this.' wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'The names for many of these ingredients have changed since...  How old is this recipe anyway??' wait 1s beam say I love it. wait 3s emote begins writing down a list of notes. wait 1s say ... and this is called this... wait 1s say ... this can be substituted with this... wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, '... that's been extinct for over a century, so perhaps this will do...?' wait 4s emote finishes her list. mload obj 18520 give notes %actor.name% wait 2s say That should help you.  I can't wait to hear how it goes! wave %actor% halt endif endif endif * * Original resumes here * * Preset item and recipe vars set item4 0 set item5 0 set item6 0 set item7 0 set stage %actor.quest_stage[resort_cooking]% set recipe1 Peach Cobbler set recipe2 Seafood Salad set recipe3 Fish Stew set recipe4 Honey-Glazed Ham set recipe5 Saffroned Jasmine Rice switch %stage% case 1 set recipe %recipe1% set next %recipe2% set item1 61501 set item2 23754 set item3 3114 set item4 35001 break case 2 set recipe %recipe2% set next %recipe3% set item1 49024 set item2 23750 set item3 23722 set item4 8003 set item5 12515 set item6 1606 break case 3 set recipe %recipe3% set next %recipe4% set item1 55213 set item2 30002 set item3 10030 set item4 12552 set item5 23757 set item6 18509 set item7 10311 break case 4 set recipe %recipe4% set next %recipe5% set item1 41011 set item2 8350 set item3 2001 set item4 50207 set item5 6106 break case 5 set recipe %recipe5% set item1 58019 set item2 37013 set item3 23760 break default return 0 say I don't have time for that right now. emote refuses your item. halt done * What item is being turned in? switch %object.vnum% case %item1% set item 1 break case %item2% set item 2 break case %item3% set item 3 break case %item4% set item 4 break case %item5% set item 5 break case %item6% set item 6 break case %item7% set item 7 break default return 0 mecho %self.name% says, 'The recipe doesn't call for this!  Perhaps you should consult the recipe on the wall to refresh your memory.' halt done if %actor.quest_variable[resort_cooking:item%item%]% return 0 mecho %self.name% says, 'You already brought in %object.shortdesc%, so we don't need more.' emote hands your item back to you. halt endif wait 1 mjunk %object.name% wait 4 mecho %self.name% says, 'Just what we need for &7&b%recipe%&0!' quest variable resort_cooking %actor.name% item%item% 1 * See if we've turned in everything for this recipe set item 1 while %item% <= 7 set item%item% 0 eval item %item% + 1 done if %actor.quest_variable[resort_cooking:item1]% set item1 1 endif if %actor.quest_variable[resort_cooking:item2]% set item2 1 endif if %actor.quest_variable[resort_cooking:item3]% set item3 1 endif if %stage% == 5 || %actor.quest_variable[resort_cooking:item4]% set item4 1 endif if %stage% == 1 || %stage% == 5 || %actor.quest_variable[resort_cooking:item5]% set item5 1 endif if (%stage% != 2 && %stage != 3) || %actor.quest_variable[resort_cooking:item6]% set item6 1 endif if %stage% != 3 || %actor.quest_variable[resort_cooking:item7]% set item7 1 endif * If all the items have been turned in, start mixing if %item1% && %item2% && %item3% && %item4% && %item5% && %item6% && %item7% quest advance resort_cooking %actor.name% set item 1 * Reset item variables while %item% <= 7 quest variable resort_cooking %actor.name% item%item% 0 eval item %item% + 1 done say I think I can start preparing it now. wait 1s emote gets the other ingredients from the icebox. emote begins mixing them together. wait 2s if %stage% == 5 mecho %self.name% says, 'You've been such a great help, %actor.name%!  Now I'm almost prepared for this huge dinner party, thanks!' wait 3s say I'd like you to have this. wait 5 mecho %self.name% says, 'It was enchanted by a good friend of mine, so I hope it will help you as much as you've helped me.' mload obj 10315 set gem 0 while %gem% < 3 eval drop %random.11% + 55736 mload obj %drop% eval gem %gem% + 1 done give all.gem %actor% * * Set X to the level of the award - code does not run without it * if %actor.level% < 65 set expcap %actor.level% else set expcap 65 endif set expmod 0 if %expcap% < 9 eval expmod (((%expcap% * %expcap%) + %expcap%) / 2) * 55 elseif %expcap% < 17 eval expmod 440 + ((%expcap% - 8) * 125) elseif %expcap% < 25 eval expmod 1440 + ((%expcap% - 16) * 175) elseif %expcap% < 34 eval expmod 2840 + ((%expcap% - 24) * 225) elseif %expcap% < 49 eval expmod 4640 + ((%expcap% - 32) * 250) elseif %expcap% < 90 eval expmod 8640 + ((%expcap% - 48) * 300) else eval expmod 20940 + ((%expcap% - 89) * 600) endif * * Adjust exp award by class so all classes receive the same proportionate amount * switch %actor.class% case Warrior case Berserker * * 110% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + (%expmod% / 10)) break case Paladin case Anti-Paladin case Ranger * * 115% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + ((%expmod% * 2) / 15) break case Sorcerer case Pyromancer case Cryomancer case Illusionist case Bard * * 120% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + (%expmod% / 5)) break case Necromancer case Monk * * 130% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + (%expmod% * 2) / 5) break default set expmod %expmod% done msend %actor% &3&bYou gain experience!&0 eval setexp (%expmod% * 10) set loop 0 while %loop% < 10 * * Xexp must be replaced by mexp, oexp, or wexp for this code to work * Pick depending on what is running the trigger * mexp %actor% %setexp% eval loop %loop% + 1 done quest complete resort_cooking %actor.name% else mecho %self.name% says, 'I'll keep preparing this while you collect items for the next recipe.' ponder wait 1s say The next dish is %next%. wait 2 say Here's the recipe.  Please take a look at it. emote points out a slip of paper hanging on the wall. endif else emote puts the item into the icebox. wait 1s say Thanks!  Quickly, bring the rest! endif drop all

One wsend %actor% &0especially stands out among the mess. wsend %actor% &0 wsend %actor% &0==========&7&b%recipe%&0========== if %item1% wsend %actor% &0  %get.obj_shortdesc[%item1%]% endif if %item2% wsend %actor% &0  %get.obj_shortdesc[%item2%]% endif if %item3% wsend %actor% &0  %get.obj_shortdesc[%item3%]% endif if %item4% wsend %actor% &0  %get.obj_shortdesc[%item4%]% endif if %item5% wsend %actor% &0  %get.obj_shortdesc[%item5%]% endif if %item6% wsend %actor% &0  %get.obj_shortdesc[%item6%]% endif if %item7% wsend %actor% &0  %get.obj_shortdesc[%item7%]% endif elseif %arg% /= icebox wsend %actor% Looking inside the icebox, you see: set nothing 1 if %actor.quest_variable[resort_cooking:item1]% wsend %actor% &0  %get.obj_shortdesc[%item1%]% set nothing 0 endif if %actor.quest_variable[resort_cooking:item2]% wsend %actor% &0  %get.obj_shortdesc[%item2%]% set nothing 0 endif if %actor.quest_variable[resort_cooking:item3]% wsend %actor% &0  %get.obj_shortdesc[%item3%]% set nothing 0 endif if %actor.quest_variable[resort_cooking:item4]% wsend %actor% &0  %get.obj_shortdesc[%item4%]% set nothing 0 endif if %actor.quest_variable[resort_cooking:item5]% wsend %actor% &0  %get.obj_shortdesc[%item5%]% set nothing 0 endif if %actor.quest_variable[resort_cooking:item6]% wsend %actor% &0  %get.obj_shortdesc[%item6%]% set nothing 0 endif if %actor.quest_variable[resort_cooking:item7]% wsend %actor% &0  %get.obj_shortdesc[%item7%]% set nothing 0 endif if %nothing% wsend %actor% &0  Nothing. endif else return 0 endif

triggers.name: hot-spring
triggers.commands: if !%actor% set actor %random.char% endif if !%actor% halt endif set fireproof %actor.aff_flagged[!HEAT]% if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.class% == Pyromancer elseif %fireproof% else eval damage %random.10% + %random.10% wechoaround %actor% %actor.name% starts to look a bit woozy from the extreme heat. wsend %actor% The water is too hot for you.... wdamage %actor% %damage% end end

triggers.name: khysan-greet
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[ice_shards]% set return yes endif if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% > %wandstep% set return yes endif if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% && %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 1 set return yes endif wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% looks up at your approach. if %return% == yes say Welcome back my friend. wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[ice_shards]% && !%actor.has_completed[ice_shards]% say Did you find any more clues? if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% eval minlevel (%wandstep% - 1) * 10 wait 1s if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 say Or is there something else that brings you back? else say Or do you have what I need for a new staff? endif endif endif else if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% eval minlevel (%wandstep% - 1) * 10 if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 say Is there something else that brings you back? else say Do you have what I need for a new staff? endif endif endif endif else mecho %self.name% smiles warmly and says, 'Welcome to Phoenix Feather Resort.' wait 1s say We are currently offering free services to all adventurers. wait 1s bow %actor% say Please enjoy your stay.  You may enter the hot springs to the south. if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% wait 1s eval minlevel (%wandstep% - 1) * 10 if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 mecho %self.name% says, 'I see you're crafting something.  If you want my help, we can talk about &6&b[upgrades]&0.' endif endif endif if !%actor.quest_stage[ice_shards]% wait 3 if %actor.class% /= Cryomancer if %actor.has_completed[major_globe_spell]% && %actor.has_completed[relocate_spell_quest]% && %actor.has_completed[wall_ice]% && %actor.has_completed[waterform]% && %actor.has_completed[flood]% say Oh, %actor.name% %actor.title%!  I've heard of you!  You're quite talked about amongst our fellow cryomancers. if %actor.level% > 88 mecho &0 say Makes me wonder if you could have mastered the most powerful cryomantic spell ever known. endif endif endif endif endif

triggers.name: ice_shards_khysan_speech1
triggers.argument_list: spell spell? powerful powerful?  Ever ever?
triggers.commands: if %actor.class% /= Cryomancer wait 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'The spell was called Ice Shards.  Supreme cryomancers mecho &0could conjure a multitude of glistening ice fragments to annihilate their mecho &0foes.' wait 2s say But that magic is lost to us now. endif

triggers.name: ice_shards_khysan_speech2
triggers.commands: if %actor.class% /= Cryomancer wait 2 nod mecho %self.name% says, 'Even my elven family, the Sunfire clan, has lost the mecho &0secrets to the spell.' wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'Legend has it the last copy of Ice Shards was in the mecho &0fabled lost library of Shiran.  But perhaps the spell survived in some ancient mecho &0text.' wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'I've heard of four books that could potentially hold the information:' mecho &3&bthe Book of Kings&0 mecho &3&bthe Book of Discipline&0 mecho &3&bThe Xapizan Codex&0 mecho &3&bthe Enchiridion&0 mecho mecho %self.name% says, 'Maybe if I could get my hands on each of them, between mecho &0them I could piece together fragments of the spell!' wait 3s say Will you track down these books and bring them to me? endif

triggers.name: ice_shards_khysan_speech3
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.class% /= Cryomancer if %actor.level% > 88 && %actor.quest_stage[ice_shards]% == 0 quest start ice_shards %actor.name% beam say Excellent!  I'm excited! wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'If you need, you can check your &6&b[ice shards progress]&0 with me.' elseif %actor.level% > 88 && %actor.quest_stage[ice_shards]% > 0 say Oh please do share! elseif %actor.level% =< 88 mecho %self.name% says, 'I appreciate your enthusiasm, but it's probably too mecho &0dangerous, right?' endif endif

triggers.name: ice_shards_khysan_receive1
triggers.commands: set stage %actor.quest_stage[ice_shards]% if %stage% == 1 if %actor.quest_variable[ice_shards:%object.vnum%]% == 1 return 0 mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 say Thanks, but you already delivered %object.shortdesc% to me. else quest variable ice_shards %actor.name% %object.vnum% 1 mjunk book wait 2 mecho %self.name%'s eyes grow wide. mecho say This is incredible!  I never imagined I'd be holding a copy of %object.shortdesc%! wait 2 set book1 %actor.quest_variable[ice_shards:16209]% set book2 %actor.quest_variable[ice_shards:18505]% set book3 %actor.quest_variable[ice_shards:55003]% set book4 %actor.quest_variable[ice_shards:58415]% if %book1% && %book2% && %book3% && %book4% quest advance ice_shards %actor.name% emote slowly reads through the contents of each book. wait 4s emote takes copious notes. wait 1s say Hmmmm, I wonder if... wait 1s say No, that won't work... wait 4s emote sighs with frustration. say I hate to say it, but this isn't going to cut it.  The texts just don't have enough information about the spell. wait 3s ponder mecho %self.name% says, 'There is a mention of Shiran being near Mt. Frostbite in the Xapizan Codex however.  It also mentions a brother codex called &3&b"The Codex of War"&0. wait 2s say Supposedly, the Codex of War contains a detailed history of battles in the region.  Maybe if Shiran was destroyed in some kind of conflict, the Codex of War might have more clues. wait 2s say Try to find a copy and bring it back so we can take a look at it! else say Did you manage to find any of the other books? endif endif endif

triggers.name: ice_shards_pawnbroker_speech
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.quest_stage[ice_shards]% == 4 say Sorry, never heard of 'im. wait 1s cough emote very conspicuously lays his open hand on the counter. wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'I have some great old boots for sale though. mecho &0Only &7&b100 platinum&0.' else say Ya might not wanna be so loud with that name round 'ere. endif

triggers.name: ice_shards_pawnbroker_bribe
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[ice_shards]% == 4 quest advance ice_shards %actor.name% wait 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'I don't know much, but I do know someone paid me to help mecho &0'im slip outta the city.  I'm talkin', they paid A LOT.  Was a dark-skinned elf mecho &0with a buncha orcs.' wait 5s mecho %self.name% says, 'Not the guy ya see skulkin' round the neighborhood or mecho &0nothin' neither, nah.  This guy looked like 'e worked with money.' wait 4s mecho %self.name% says, 'Dunno where they was goin' but I got a feelin' it were mecho &0pretty far.  They was all talkin' 'bout Ogakh or some such.  I dunno, my Orcish mecho &0ain't too good these days.' wait 4s say Best of luck catchin' 'im.  Now get out. mecho emote points towards the door. endif

triggers.name: ice_shards_slevvirik_speech
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[ice_shards]% == 5 quest advance ice_shards %actor.name% wait 2 sigh mecho %self.name% says, 'Yes, I do know where he is and before you ask, no I don't mind mecho &0telling you.  My contractual obligation to him is fulfilled and if I do tell mecho &0you where he is, I doubt it will make much of a difference.' wait 5s mecho %self.name% says, 'That beast knew his reputation was going to catch up to him mecho &0sooner or later.  He paid us to hide him where no one in the world would find mecho &0him.  So we hid him off world.' wait 6s mecho %self.name% says, 'We opened a gateway to the Plane of Earth and sent him on his mecho &0way.  I suppose he's still there.' wait 4s say If he's still alive. wait 1s tip %actor% endif
